TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by ORG , a firm of solicitors practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr. C. Whomersley of ORG .

At the time of the events in question the applicant was a soldier in ORG , holding the rank of Craftsman in the CARDINALth ORG of ORG and ORG . In DATE the applicant ’s regiment were on a tour of duty in GPE . On TIME CARDINAL September CARDINAL an altercation took place in a transit accommodation block between the applicant and another soldier , witnessed by CARDINAL others . Statements were taken from the witnesses , but these were subsequently destroyed in view of the fact that the regiment was shortly to return to GPE where the incident would be investigated by the military police .

Following the investigation , the applicant was charged with assault occasioning actual bodily harm , contrary to section CARDINAL of the Army Act DATE ( see below ) . He pleaded not guilty on grounds of self - defence . His case was heard before a district court martial held at GPE DATE and DATE . The applicant was legally represented at , and subsequent to , the hearing . The court martial consisted of CARDINAL military officers and an Assistant Judge Advocate General . The applicant was found guilty and , on DATE , he was sentenced to CARDINAL months’ detention and ordered to undergo stoppages of pay until he had made good the sum of GBP CARDINAL by way of compensation to the victim of the assault . A petition for review of the finding and sentence of DATE was refused by ORG on DATE .

The applicant applied for leave to appeal against conviction to ORG on DATE , on the grounds that the trial judge had been wrong to allow the trial to continue given the destruction of the witness statements , and that the conviction was therefore unsafe and unsatisfactory . Leave to appeal against conviction was granted by a single judge on DATE . The appeal was dismissed on CARDINAL DATE .

Between his conviction and the hearing of his appeal , the applicant was detained in ORG . Under the Army Act DATE as amended by LAW ( which came into force on DATE ) , neither the district court martial nor ORG nor ORG had any power to grant the applicant bail pending the determination of his appeal .

Section CARDINAL of the Army Act DATE ( “ the DATE LAW ) renders offences under ordinary criminal law committed by members of the armed services offences against military law . Offences against military law are tried by way of court martial .
Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ( as amended by the armed Forces Act CARDINAL ) provides ( as relevant ) :
“ CARDINAL.(CARDINAL ) Where a court - martial has found the accused guilty of any offence , the accused may ... present a petition to ORG against finding or sentence or both .
( CARDINAL ) The reviewing authority shall ... review any finding of guilt made , and sentence passed , by a court martial . ...
( CARDINAL ) For the purposes of this LAW the reviewing authority is -
( b ) any officer to whom all or any of the powers of ORG as reviewing authority may be delegated by ORG . ”

Under section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , a court martial on passing sentence , or the reviewing authority acting under LAW above , may order that a sentence be suspended . Under section CARDINAL ) of the LAW , where a sentence has been suspended before committal to detention it shall not begin to run until the suspension is determined .

Under section CARDINALA of LAW , a court martial on passing sentence , or the reviewing authority acting under LAW above , may alternatively order that a sentence be postponed until DATE specified in the order . In the event of such an order , the sentence continues to run from the date on which it was pronounced , but does not have effect throughout the period of postponement .
Section CARDINAL of LAW DATE provides ORG with a power to grant bail to a civilian appellant in a criminal case pending the hearing of his appeal .
